message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with improving the performance and energy-efficiency of machine-learning hardware, which suggests it belongs to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. The paper also proposes a bio-plausible alternative to backpropagation, which is a common training algorithm used in deep neural networks, indicating that it could also belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper specifically focuses on deep convolutional neural networks, which suggests it could belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. The paper also involves training algorithms and optimization techniques, which could place it in the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with hardware optimization, which suggests it could also belong to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
